intro: Antidaphne orbicularis, commonly known as the round-leaved antidaphne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its orbicular, or round, leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant is part of the family Piperaceae, which includes other species with similar morphological features. Antidaphne orbicularis typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique leaf shape and potential medicinal properties.
